stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the stream building Course 14, a craft-themed winter area made of cardboard, Styrofoam and paper. He implements a timed matchbox bridge, paper-snowball hazards, and a falling paper-snowflake ambient effect while discussing collectible design, demo plans, engine choices, and team art tasks.

development_findings.summary: Red coins are now confined to one small area per course, Yoshi coins replace 100-coin stars, and a seventh act (‘Find the Egg Coins’) appears after collecting the first six stars, aided by a proximity radar.
development_findings.quote: Red coins in this game are always contained to one area because otherwise red coins suck… once you have the first six stars you get the seventh star which is just Find the Egg Coins and it has this radar.

development_findings.summary: All 100-coin stars are removed to stop players from interrupting flow or getting trapped after collecting partial coins.
development_findings.quote: No level has a 100 coin star… it just feels like shit.

development_findings.summary: Collect-text stars (red coins, Yoshi coins) never kick the player out of a level; most narrative stars still do to avoid soft-locks.
development_findings.quote: Red coins just don’t kick you out and Yoshi coin star doesn’t kick you out.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a dynamic cardboard matchbox bridge: a pair of matchboxes slide out, form a bridge for a few seconds, then retract. Uses existing door-switch behavior with distance & speed tuning.
development_findings.quote: Imagine you press the switch, the bridge comes out, and then it slowly goes back… I think that would be a good way to make this work.

development_findings.summary: Created crumpled-paper snowballs that fall at fixed intervals, alternating left/right target offsets; planned to spawn them from the sky until a better launcher prop is decided.
development_findings.quote: The snowball spawning there looks really bad… maybe just having it fall from the sky is the way to go for now.

development_findings.summary: Repurposed the Course 7 leaf particle system to render small white paper-snowflake sprites (96 on screen) with minimal performance cost.
development_findings.quote: Rendering all of these snowballs combined is as much as like two of Mario’s arms.

development_findings.summary: Noted lighting bugs with per-vertex normals on irregular meshes; will adjust material (no lighting, flat white texture) to avoid artifacts on paper snow.
development_findings.quote: For some reason the lighting looks very off… we’ll probably just go texture-only, no shade color.

development_findings.summary: Planned a temporary global-coin NPC for the demo: players can donate coins three times to upgrade the NPC’s hat (bronze→silver→gold) but receive no reward, illustrating future overworld economy.
development_findings.quote: For the demo there’s just gonna be one guy… you can gift me your coins and I will buy myself a new hat… you get nothing.

development_findings.summary: Demo release targeted for ‘a few weeks’ after upcoming BLJ and channel-status videos; will include only Course 1 but with all recent improvements.
development_findings.quote: I’m gonna make a demo of just course one again… the demo release is gonna be in a few weeks.

development_findings.summary: Considering Godot for a future original game because Unreal Engine is ‘so goddamn slow’; appreciates faster iteration and easier console ports.
development_findings.quote: If I’m gonna make my own game, we are probably using Godot… Unreal is so goddamn slow.

context_findings.summary: Stream framed as ‘work first, entertainment incidental’; Kaze openly codes while chatting and even pauses to do live workouts to balance health.
context_findings.quote: My priority today is not on entertaining but rather on getting work done… I have natural obligations such as working out.

context_findings.summary: Reveals rebellious stance toward Nintendo legal threats; once replied ‘suck my cock’ (with leetspeak) to a formal DMCA and faced no consequences.
context_findings.quote: They basically were like we can take your entire life away… and I responded suck my cock.

context_findings.summary: Shows satisfaction when mechanics ‘feel right’ and frustration with minor visual glitches or lighting bugs.
Birthday occurred two days before stream; appreciates community donations but downplays celebration.

biobak.summary: Re-worked ‘zoo’ models earlier and gives real-time feedback on Styrofoam visuals, HUD layout, and overall scene coziness.
biobak.quote: Biobak did rework the zoo ones… what do you think of the new Styrofoam? Your opinion here matters.

biobak.summary: Will create higher-quality textures (e.g., matchbox labels, exclamation boxes) after Kaze’s temporary placeholders.
biobak.quote: Surely this conveys the idea and Zeina can make a decent one.

zeina.summary: Appears on stream with their baby; Kaze asks her to paint final textures for matchbox props and possibly the new exclamation box.
zeina.quote: Hopefully Zeina will make a decent one that is better than what I’m making here.

key_stories.title: Redesigning Collectibles
key_stories.summary: Kaze explains why traditional red-coin and 100-coin stars feel tedious and how he rebuilt the system with localized red coins, exploratory Yoshi coins, and a radar-guided seventh star.
key_stories.challenge: Traditional Mario 64 coin objectives break pacing and trap players.
key_stories.process: Confined red coins to single areas, abolished 100-coin stars, introduced globally tracked Yoshi coins with radar on Act 7.
key_stories.outcome: Levels encourage exploration without frustration; star flow remains clear.
key_stories.key_quote: No level has a 100 coin star… it just feels like shit, so I killed it.

key_stories.title: Building the Matchbox Bridge
key_stories.summary: Course 14 needed a temporary bridge over Styrofoam. Kaze prototypes sliding matchboxes that act as a timed platform using reused door-switch code.
key_stories.challenge: Create a craft-themed, narratively coherent timed bridge that doesn’t require complex new code.
key_stories.process: Modelled cardboard matchboxes, applied placeholder textures, duplicated door-switch behavior, tuned distance (917 units) and speed, added acceleration curve.
key_stories.outcome: Functional bridge that visually fits the craft world; further art polish delegated to team.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine you press the switch, the bridge comes out, and then it slowly goes back – this is what video games should be like.
